definition: the old and the young/the youngest member of the family

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
(coll.) as one ages, one becomes more and more like a child

sentences.english: Being the youngest and spoilt, my with was granted.
sentences.chinese: 作为家中的老小被娇生惯养，我的愿望被满足了。

sentences.english: He has a wife and family depending on him.
Tomorrow I will bring them to my home, and from now on we will live together and wait for your return.
sentences.chinese: 你的老小，我明日便取回去养在家里，待你回来完聚。

sentences.english: Several years later, Zhang Kan alas a disease, leaving a hard to make ends meet youngest.
sentences.chinese: 过了几年，张堪一病呜呼，丢下一家老小艰辛度日。

sentences.english: The traditional food of the festival is sweet dumplings, which symbolize reunion.
sentences.chinese: 汤圆又称元宵，象征着一家老小团团圆圆，幸福完美。

sentences.english: I'm sure that I shall be well able to provide for my wife and family.
sentences.chinese: 我确信我将完全能养活我的妻儿老小。

sentences.english: Have families around the fire, in the Lang Lang laughter arcing began.
sentences.chinese: 一家老小围着火堆，在朗朗笑声中跳火开始了。

sentences.english: The man together with his wife and children sits on the sofa watching TV.
sentences.chinese: 那个人和他妻儿老小坐在沙发上看电视。

sentences.english: The first one is first and last borns.
sentences.chinese: 首先应该是老大与老小。

definition: dragged down by having a family to feed
(old) child, particularly referring to the son who resembles his father
(of cousins) descending from the same grandfather or great-grandfather
